name: Vitamin A (Retinol)
description: Fat-soluble vitamin for vision, skin and immune health. Avoid high doses long-term; pregnancy caution.

name: Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid)
description: Antioxidant supporting immune function and collagen formation; divide doses to reduce GI upset.

name: Vitamin D3 (Cholecalciferol)
description: Supports bone, immunity and mood. Often deficient at higher latitudes; pair with K2 for bone health.

name: Vitamin K2 (MK-7)
description: Directs calcium to bones and away from arteries; commonly paired with Vitamin D.

name: Folate (L-Methylfolate)
description: Active B9 for methylation and homocysteine regulation; preferable in those with MTHFR variants.

name: Vitamin B12 (Methylcobalamin)
description: Supports energy metabolism and nerve health; useful for vegetarians/vegans.

name: Magnesium (Glycinate)
description: Cofactor in hundreds of enzymes; supports sleep, relaxation and muscle function.

name: Zinc (Picolinate)
description: Immune and hormonal support; avoid chronic high doses to prevent copper depletion.

name: Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)
description: Cardiovascular and cognitive support; often 1–2 g combined EPA/DHA daily.

name: Creatine Monohydrate
description: Improves high‑intensity performance and may support cognition; daily 3–5 g.

name: Beta‑Alanine
description: Buffers muscle acidity via carnosine; useful for anaerobic efforts; tingling is common.

name: Citrulline Malate
description: Boosts nitric oxide via arginine; may improve endurance and perceived pump.

name: L‑Carnitine (ALCAR)
description: Mitochondrial support; may aid mental energy and fat metabolism.

name: L‑Tyrosine
description: Catecholamine precursor; supports focus under stress/sleep loss.

name: 5‑HTP
description: Serotonin precursor; often used for sleep and appetite. Avoid with SSRIs/MAOIs.

name: Ashwagandha (KSM‑66/Sensoril)
description: Adaptogen for stress, sleep and recovery; typical 300–600 mg.

name: Rhodiola Rosea
description: Adaptogen for fatigue and resilience; take earlier in the day.

name: Green Tea Extract (EGCG)
description: Antioxidant catechins for weight management; avoid high doses on empty stomach.

name: Berberine
description: Insulin sensitivity and glucose control; take with meals; can interact with meds.

name: Inositol (Myo‑inositol)
description: Supports insulin signalling and mood; often 2–4 g/day; common in PCOS protocols.

name: CoQ10 (Ubiquinone/Ubiquinol)
description: Mitochondrial antioxidant; supports energy and cardiovascular health; take with fat.

name: Nicotinamide Riboside (NR)
description: NAD+ precursor explored for cellular energy and healthy ageing.

name: Resveratrol (Trans‑Resveratrol)
description: Polyphenol associated with cardiometabolic support; take with fat for absorption.

name: Garlic (Aged Extract)
description: Cardiometabolic support; can modestly lower blood pressure and improve lipids.

name: Milk Thistle (Silymarin)
description: Liver support; consider if using hepatically‑metabolised meds; quality matters.

name: Curcumin (with Piperine)
description: Anti‑inflammatory polyphenol; combine with piperine or liposomal forms to enhance absorption.

name: Spirulina
description: Algae rich in protein and phycocyanin; supports lipids and blood pressure.

name: Chlorella
description: Nutrient‑dense algae; used for general wellness; build dose gradually.

name: Melatonin
description: Sleep onset support; use low dose and good sleep hygiene; shift‑work/travel friendly.

name: Magnesium Threonate
description: Form that may cross blood–brain barrier more readily; often used for sleep and calm.

name: Ginkgo Biloba
description: May support circulation and cognition; mild antiplatelet effect—use caution with blood thinners.

name: Panax Ginseng
description: Adaptogen for energy and fatigue resistance; consider cycling.

name: Shilajit (Purified)
description: Ayurvedic mineral resin; early evidence for vitality; ensure heavy‑metal testing.

name: Boron
description: Ultratrace mineral; explored for hormone and bone support; keep dose modest.

name: Chromium (Picolinate)
description: Glucose metabolism support; modest effects on insulin sensitivity in some.

name: Betaine (TMG)
description: Methyl donor; may aid training power and homocysteine control when combined with B‑vitamins.

name: Electrolytes (Sodium/Potassium/Magnesium)
description: Hydration and performance support; adjust to sweat rate and climate.

name: Probiotics (Multi‑strain)
description: Gut health and regularity; strain‑specific effects; introduce gradually.

name: Berkeley Life Nitrate (Beetroot)
description: Dietary nitrates for nitric oxide; may reduce blood pressure and improve exercise economy.

name: HMB (β‑Hydroxy β‑Methylbutyrate)
description: Leucine metabolite that may reduce muscle breakdown—useful when training volume is low or during cuts.
